meanings.definition: The action of reducing or restricting something.
meanings.sent1: The curtailment of our budget led to fewer resources for the project.
meanings.sent2: The government announced a curtailment of public spending to address the economic crisis.
meanings.sent3: The curtailment of candy at the office caused a wave of disappointment among employees.
meanings.sent4: Her strict curtailment of screen time for her kids was met with resistance.
meanings.sent5: The curtailment of water supply during the drought highlighted the importance of conservation.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting short or reducing in duration.
meanings.sent1: The sudden curtailment of the concert left the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent2: The curtailment of the meeting allowed everyone to leave early.
meanings.sent3: The curtailment of his story at the cliffhanger left us all hanging.
meanings.sent4: The curtailment of the movie's runtime made it more enjoyable for viewers.
meanings.sent5: The curtailment of the play's final act left the audience in suspense.
